attributes.action: Introduce legislation to enable professionals, in child protection services, to carry out surveillance on families where there has been, or if their is evidence of a significant risk of, abuse to a child/children
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Surveillance should be able to be carried out without parental consent or foreknowledge in situations where it is believed that a child is being abused. This should apply where there has been past evidence of abuse to a child, or if there is reason to suspect abuse of a child, in order to assess the safety of the child/children in question. Any resulting evidence/confirmation of abuse should be passed on to police, social services and relevant health departments.
